thread.title: Donald Trump doesn't expect SNL to drop him, in spite of pressure from Hispanic group - US TV
thread.title_full: Donald Trump doesn't expect SNL to drop him, in spite of pressure from Hispanic group - US TV News - Digital Spy

author: Justin Harp
title: Donald Trump doesn't expect SNL to drop him, in spite of pressure from Hispanic group - US TV
text: Donald Trump does not expect Saturday Night Live to drop him from an upcoming episode, despite pressure from Hispanic groups.The National Hispanic Foundation for the Arts penned an open letter to NBC, calling on the network to disinvite Trump from hosting SNL over his controversial comments about Latino people. © Getty Images / Isaac Brekken Donald Trump on Celebrity Apprentice: 'NBC would dump Arnold Schwarzenegger if I'd return'The group wrote: "Donald Trump has yet to apologise for his bigoted comments about Mexican immigrants. Allowing Trump to host SNL will legitimize and validate his anti-Latino comments. "NHLA had praised NBCUniversal, when it severed its ties with Donald Trump. We are appalled that you would enable Trump's hateful speech for nothing less than a ratings ploy and ask that you rescind the SNL invitation."NBC dropped its business relationship with former Celebrity Apprentice host Trump over the summer, after he suggested that Mexico was sending "rapists" and drug dealers over the US border.Trump addressed the furor over his SNL hosting stint on Fox & Friends today (October 19), promising that the ratings will be "through the roof"."I'm leading in the polls with the Hispanics," he added. 'I mean, you look at Nevada, I'm leading in the polls with the Hispanics because I produce jobs, and they know it. © Getty Images / Isaac Brekken "I have thousands of Hispanics that work for me, my relationships to Hispanics is better than those groups. Those groups are looking to fundraise, I know all about those groups."He went on to call SNL producer Lorne Michaels a "very smart guy" for inviting him to host the sketch comedy series.Trump's presidential rival Hillary Clinton made a cameo on Saturday Night Live earlier in the season.Trump and musical guest Sia appear on the next live SNL episode, airing on NBC on November 7.
